meanings.definition: The condition of having an abnormal accumulation of fluid in tissues or cavities of the body.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with hydropses after noticing severe swelling in the legs.
meanings.sent2: Her hydropses was causing discomfort and restricted movement.
meanings.sent3: The balloon animal's hydropses made it look like a pufferfish.
meanings.sent4: The city streets flooded, creating a hydropses of water and chaos.
meanings.sent5: The hydropses in the basement was so severe, it reached ankle-deep levels.

meanings.definition: To experience swelling or edema due to excess fluid retention.
meanings.sent1: After the long flight, her ankles began to hydropses, making it hard to walk.
meanings.sent2: He hydropses every summer due to the heat causing water retention.
meanings.sent3: The sponge hydropses when soaked in water, expanding in size.
meanings.sent4: Emotions can sometimes hydropses within us, overwhelming our hearts.
meanings.sent5: The river hydropses after heavy rainfall, flooding the surrounding fields.
